paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant pV142I, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: self-identified Black individuals, >60 years of age

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Despite the large number of known pV142I carriers, the proportion of older Black patients with heart failure attributable to ATTR‐CM remains unknown.

functional_data.summary: The pV142I variant is associated with misfolding and deposition of transthyretin protein.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families of affected individuals.
variants.population_frequency: 3.4% in self-identified Black individuals in the U.S.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is almost exclusively observed in individuals of West African ancestry.
key_quotes: Variant ATTR‐CM is most commonly caused by the substitution of valine for isoleucine at position 122 in transthyretin (Val122Ile or pV142I).
The proportion of older Black patients with heart failure attributable to ATTR‐CM remains unknown.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was primarily from the main text, with no additional tables providing variant information.
